Package games

Class OutcomeDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • games.OutcomeDistribution

  • public final class OutcomeDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a distribution over outcomes in a game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutcomeDistribution(int[] nActions)
      Create a new distribution object Initialized by default to the centroid (equal probabilities for all outcomes)
      OutcomeDistribution(int[] nActions, double initialValue)
      Create a new distribution object Initial all probabilities to the given value
      OutcomeDistribution(int[] nActions, java.util.Collection<int[]> outcomes)
      Creates a new distribution based on a set of outcomes, with equal weight given to all
      OutcomeDistribution(OutcomeDistribution original) 
      OutcomeDistribution(java.util.List<MixedStrategy> strategies)
      Create a new distribution object based on the joint mixed strategies given

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double computeEntropy() 
      OutcomeDistribution getConditionalDistribution(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> restrictedPlayers)
      Returns the conditional distribution for the given restriction set
      double[] getMarginalDistribution(int player)
      Compute the marginal distribution for a given player's actions
      int[] getNumActions() 
      int getNumPlayers() 
      double getProb(int[] outcome) 
      boolean isValid()
      Check whether this is a valid probability distribution (sums to 1) Uses a tolerance of 0.01, so anything between 0.99 and 1.01 is "valid"
      OutcomeIterator iterator() 
      void mixWithUniform(double delta) 
      void normalize()
      normalize this distribution so that it sums to 1 If the sum of current values is 0, set the values to the centroid
      int[] sampleDistribution() 
      void setAll(double value)
      Sets all probabilities to the given value
      void setCentroid()
      Sets this distribution to represent the centroid
      void setMixedStrategies(java.util.List<MixedStrategy> strategies)
      Sets the distribution based on the given mixed strategies
      void setOutcomeSet(java.util.Collection<int[]> outcomes)
      Sets the distribution to an even distribution over the given outcomes
      void setProb(int[] outcome, double value) 
      void setPureOutcome(int[] outcome) 
      void setRandomPureProfile() 
      java.lang.String toString()

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Check whether this is a valid probability distribution (sums to 1) Uses a tolerance of 0.01, so anything between 0.99 and 1.01 is "valid"
        Returns:
        true if distribution sums to 1, false otherwise
